message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.DC 

The paper discusses the need for interoperability between scholarly repositories and proposes a data model and service architecture to enable this. The paper also describes an experiment involving the creation of an overlay journal using several different repository systems. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DL (Digital Libraries) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Other possible sub-categories include cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) as they may also be relevant to the topic of scholarly communication and repository interoperability.
